    • Field Detail

      • CANONICAL_NAME_PATTERN

        public static final java.util.regex.Pattern CANONICAL_NAME_PATTERN
        Regex to validate a full canonical name. Groups are used to separate each component.

        A canonical name should have any of the following structures: 

         <host>%<port>_<language>
 <host>%<port>_<language>:<container>
 <host>%<port>_<language>:<container>:<engine>

 With %<port> part being optional.

    • Method Detail

      • isCanonicalName

        public static boolean isCanonicalName​(java.lang.String name)
        Checks if the given name is a proper ERSAP canonical name.

        A canonical name should have any of the following structures: 

         <host>%<port>_<language>
 <host>%<port>_<language>:<container>
 <host>%<port>_<language>:<container>:<engine>
        Parameters:
        name - the name to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the string is a ERSAP canonical name, false if not

      • isDpeName

        public static boolean isDpeName​(java.lang.String name)
        Checks if the given name is a proper DPE canonical name.

        A DPE canonical name should have the following structure: 

         <host>_<language>
        Parameters:
        name - the name to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the string is a DPE canonical name, false if not

      • isContainerName

        public static boolean isContainerName​(java.lang.String name)
        Checks if the given name is a proper container canonical name.

        A container canonical name should have the following structure: 

         <host>_<language>:<container>
        Parameters:
        name - the name to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the string is a container canonical name, false if not

      • isServiceName

        public static boolean isServiceName​(java.lang.String name)
        Checks if the given name is a proper service canonical name.

        A service canonical name should have the following structure: 

         <host>_<language>:<container>:<engine>
        Parameters:
        name - the name to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the string is a service canonical name, false if not

      • getContainerName

        public static java.lang.String getContainerName​(java.lang.String canonicalName)
        Gets the container name from the given ERSAP canonical name. This returns just the container name part, without the DPE name (i.e. not a container canonical name).
        Parameters:
        canonicalName - a ERSAP canonical name with a container part
        Returns:
        the container name

      • getContainerCanonicalName

        public static java.lang.String getContainerCanonicalName​(java.lang.String canonicalName)
        Gets the container canonical name from the given ERSAP canonical name. This returns the full canonical name, including the DPE name.
        Parameters:
        canonicalName - a ERSAP canonical name with a container part
        Returns:
        the container canonical name

      • getEngineName

        public static java.lang.String getEngineName​(java.lang.String canonicalName)
        Gets the service engine name from the given ERSAP canonical name. This returns just the engine name part, without the container and DPE names (i.e. not a service canonical name).
        Parameters:
        canonicalName - a service canonical name
        Returns:
        the container name

      • splitIntoLines

        public static java.lang.String splitIntoLines​(java.lang.String input,
                                              java.lang.String linePrefix,
                                              int maxLineLength)
        Splits the input string into lines of the given maximum length. Each line will be prefixed with the specified string.
        Parameters:
        input - the long string to split into lines
        linePrefix - the string to put before each line
        maxLineLength - the maximum line length, including the prefix
        Returns:
        the text split into lines

      • reportException

        public static java.lang.String reportException​(java.lang.Throwable e)
        Returns the stack trace of a exception as a string.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a string with the stack trace of the exception

      • getThrowableList

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Throwable> getThrowableList​(java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        Returns the list of Throwable objects in the exception chain.

        A throwable without cause will return a list containing one element: the input throwable. A throwable with one cause will return a list containing two elements: the input throwable and the cause throwable. A null throwable will return an empty list.

        Parameters:
        throwable - the throwable to inspect, may be null
        Returns:
        the list of throwables

      • getRootCause

        public static java.lang.Throwable getRootCause​(java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        Obtains the root cause of the given the Throwable, if any.
        Parameters:
        throwable - the throwable to get the root cause for, may be null
        Returns:
        the root cause of the Throwable, null if none found or null throwable input

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        String of the stack trace

      • sleep

        public static void sleep​(long millis)
        Causes the currently executing thread to sleep for the given number of milliseconds.

        If any thread interrupts the current thread, this method will return and the interrupt status will be set.

        Parameters:
        millis - the length of time to sleep in milliseconds

      • sleep

        public static void sleep​(long duration,
                         java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
        Causes the currently executing thread to sleep for the given duration of time.

        If any thread interrupts the current thread, this method will return and the interrupt status will be set.

        Parameters:
        duration - the length of time to sleep
        unit - the time unit for the duration of the sleep
